intro: Artia brachycarpa var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf artia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
